tool.name: Rsubread Mapping
tool.description: Produce table of feature counts using Rsubread.
tool.command:
RSubread.R align $inputFormat $refGenome.source #if $refGenome.source=="indexed" $refGenome.index.fields.path #elif $refGenome.source=="history" $refGenome.index #end if $annotation $singlePaired.sPaired
#if $singlePaired.sPaired=="single" #for $i, $fastq in enumerate($singlePaired.fastq): "fastq::$fastq.label::$fastq.group::$fastq.file" #end for #elif $singlePaired.sPaired=="paired" #for $i, $fastq in enumerate($singlePaired.fastq): "fastq::$fastq.label::$fastq.group::$fastq.pair1::$fastq.pair2" #end for #end if
$nthreads $countsOut $geneannoOut $summary $summary.files_path

param.name: source
param.label: Will you select a reference genome from your history or use a built-in index?

validator.message: No indexes are available for the selected input dataset

param.name: annotation
param.label: Genome for Feature Counts
param.help: Currently only mm9, mm10 and hg19 genomes are supported

param.name: label
param.label: Sample Label
param.help: Names of replicates should be kept distinct. Only files belonging to the same replicate should be assigned an identical label. eg. WT-1, WT-2,...

tool.help:
.. class:: infomark
**What it does**
Given fastq files and a reference genome, this tool will generate a table of feature counts along with relevant annotations for the genes.
-----
**Input Data Type**
Give information to the tool regarding whether or not the fastq files are gzipped.
**Will you select a reference genome from your history or use a built-in index?:**
Option to make use of the indicies made available by the administrator of the Galaxy instance. Alternatively an index may be built using a fasta file from history.
.. class:: infomark
Building an index is very computationally intensive and time consuming. Use built in indices whenever possible, contact your Galaxy administrator if you believe new indices should be added.
**Genome for Feature Counts:**
Select the reference genome for counting the aligned features, this should correspond to the reference genome used for alignment. Currently tool only supports mm9, mm10 and hg19 genomes.
**Is this library mate-paired?:**
Option for selecting whether the sequencing has been done on a single end or paired end. If pair-end is selected it is expected that every sample is paired end.
**FastQ Files:**
* **Sample Label:** A unique identifier for the particular sample from which the fastq file was sequenced. Multiple fastq files belonging to the same sample label will have their counts added into a single column in the counts table.
* **Experimental Group** The experimental group to which the sample belongs.
**Number of Processing Threads:** This determines how many processing threads of the CPU will be used in the alignment stage of the count summarisation. 2 threads provides a sizable speed advantage over 1 threads but additional threads will give diminishing returns and will be physically limited by available threads on the processing server.
